pr_title: Linkage Checker to verify method references to JRE classes

timeline.author: suztomo

timeline.bodyText: This was hiding the protobuf's linkage error against Java 8 runtime protocolbuffers/protobuf#7827
timeline.author: suztomo

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure lines 246-248 explain this code. It explains what we're not doing, not what we are. I suggest deleting them.
timeline.author: elharo

replies.bodyText: Removed this if-statement and moved the explanation to array class skipping.
replies.author: suztomo

timeline.bodyText: protobuf-java 3.12.4 references a Java 11 method that does not exist in Java 8
timeline.author: elharo

timeline.bodyText: will we catch a reference to an array of a missing class?
timeline.author: elharo

replies.bodyText: Yes, but not from array class reference. When there's a reference to array of a class, there should be a reference to the class in the same class file.
replies.author: suztomo

timeline.bodyText: delete this comment. It describes what the code is not doing.
timeline.author: elharo
